content.question: A soil sample near Chernobyl was found to contain <math alttext="187 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>187</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="cesium 137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cesium-</mtext><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the <math alttext="half life" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>half-life</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="cesium 137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cesium-</mtext><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is approximately <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, how much <math alttext="cesium 137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cesium-</mtext><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> will remain in the sample after <math alttext="90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years?

choices.label: <math alttext="93.50 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>93.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="23.38 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>23.38</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="6.23 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.23</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.58 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.58</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="23.38 kilobecquerels per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>23.38</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kBq/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.C: Calculate an accurate numeric answer with appropriate units.
